text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot thai kitchen and boy 
is it hot today the weather in Vancouver has

been like this for a couple weeks now and so I 
thought what a great time to do some grilling

and barbecuing so I am making barbecue chicken 
today our guy yeah guy is chicken and yang is

to grill now this is actually a new and improved 
recipe of another recipe that I've already done

before and trust me it is improved so so good 
but first got to get the marinade going so we're

going to move inside and oh if you're wondering 
about the umbrella you've been to Thailand you

know that when the Sun comes out the umbrellas 
also come out we don't like to tan so you know

this is my friend in the summer so this marinade 
is great on chicken but it's also really good on

pork or steak as well we're going to start out 
with peppercorns white peppercorns from toasted

coriander seeds and I actually got the idea of 
using coriander seeds from a barbecue chicken

out of town in Thailand that's famous for grilled 
chicken called vici and Bui and they're so famous

for their barbecue chicken and they always 
put coriander seeds in their marinade you

can definitely do this in a coffee grinder or 
even blend the whole marinade in a blender but

I like to do this old-school so once it's all very 
very fine like that we're going to add lemongrass

and I'm only using the bottom half of the stock 
the concentrated flavor is in the bottom half

garlic can't have a meat marinade without garlic 
get that into a paste so you want to get it very

very fine so you don't get big chunks of garlic 
that's going to burn on the grill so this is great

I could mix the whole marinade in here I'm going 
to transfer it into a bowl so you can see better

oh that smells good I have got soy sauce and fish 
sauce of course this is Thai food I'm also going

to add dark soy sauce or black soy sauce I should 
say and it's not very salty he's got lots of deep

rich molasses flavor in it but really what I'm 
looking for from this is just some added color

as you can see the marinade is looking very dark 
and delicious a little bit of oil just to help

moisten the chicken when it's on the grill some 
water really what I'm making is have Brian half

marinade a lot of that water is going to be 
absorbed into the chicken resulting in very

moist and juicy chicken now I also need some sugar 
some sweetness to balance all this out as simple

as that we've got our marinade now let's tackle 
the chicken so the most important thing about

this chicken is that it is bone-in and skinned on 
that's going to ensure that your chicken is moist

and juicy with lots of flavor I am using bone-in 
skin-on chicken breast and two hindquarters so

pretty much it's almost a chicken - the wings 
I'm going to break this into individual pieces

with the thighs if you've got lots of skin flaps 
I like to trim that off when you put it on the

grill it'll sort of hang into the grates and 
cost flare-ups now breasts you want to first

make a little incision there's a little cartilage 
right there push and it will open this is a keel

bone cut for on one side of this cue bone and so 
one breast will have no Cube on the other will and

that's okay now right here there's going to be a 
wishbone which you could remove but in this case

I can just break it - all right so now I've got 
two breasts that a bone-in and skinned or mu my

god these are huge all right be careful of the 
rib bones because sometimes they're very sharp

and they can puncture the bag and it can leak put 
it in another casserole dish or something so you

don't end up with chicken marinade all over your 
fridge something very satisfying about this part

mmm let this marinate for at least two hours I 
usually just do it the day before and now let's

make the ultimate Thai dipping sauce to go with 
barbecue chicken or in fact barbecued anything so

what I'm about to make is something called nothing 
doubt and I'm dim means dipping sauce and tell I

don't really know what it means but it's the name 
of this dipping sauces our go-to dip for barbecued

meats I've got some tamarind the main source of 
acidity it's nice and thick so it will give the

body to the dipping sauce and then some salty fish 
sauce of course a little bit of sweetness because

the chicken will be primarily salty so this should 
be sour and sweet to balance that out now stir

this sugar and if it's not dissolving very well 
you can quickly microwave this don't you know

bring it to a boil and evaporate everything does 
you know a few seconds to warm it up and to make

it a little fresher I like to add a little bit of 
lime juice not as much as tamarind because I do

want the tamarind flavor to be the main flavor 
some spicy of course roasted chili flakes that

I made myself but you can really put whatever 
kinds of chili flakes you want you can even put

that that chili garlic paste it comes in a jar 
with a green lid you know you know the one I'm

talking about now we need some fresh herbs green 
onions chop it finely so that it infuses it's

onion flavor into the dipping sauce some shallots 
you don't need a lot because we do have the green

onions there already now some cilantro you add it 
and it just sort of bursts with freshness as soon

as you hit it with cilantro now you don't want 
to add this in advance because it will will now

the secret ingredient well not really secret but a 
key ingredient is toasted rice powder and toasted

rice powder is used a lot in northeastern food 
and this is a northeastern dip so uncooked rice

I use sticky rice but you can do this with jasmine 
rice toast it in a dry saute pan for a few minutes

until it turns a beautiful golden color and then I 
just grind it up in a mortar and pestle until it's

quite fine and then what I get is this wonderful 
magic powder that you can add to your salads soups

dipping sauce really a lot of different things you 
can use this for too this dip it's going to add a

nuttiness to balance all that acid and it also 
adds body to make it thick so that when you dip

it into your chicken it clings on to the chicken 
and it just transforms it so so good alright ready

to go now time to grill the chicken so I've got 
my grill preheated at about medium heat okay for

this because the chicken pieces especially with 
bone-in will take quite a while to grill so you

want to grill it on sort of medium low to low heat 
depending on your grill because it will take a

good 20 20 to 30 minutes if the heats too high 
it will burn on the outside okay so I've oiled

my grill I'm going to put the chicken on what I 
know is not the hottest spot on the grill so if

you've got multiple heat settings you can put the 
chicken on indirect heat so I'm putting it skin

side up gonna close that down and now I'm going 
to lower my heat to almost to its lowest setting

and I've got my grill thermometer here I'm going 
to try to keep it at about 275 less than 300 for

sure like when I grill chicken I like to flip them 
many times I find the cooking is a lot more even

all right these are done boy these are huge 
breasts mmm smells so good all right let's go

back inside because I am burning out here I've 
got my chicken resting I've got dipping sauce

ready to go and now all I need is some sticky 
rice now you can have the chicken on its own

obviously but some sticky rice or regular rice 
will be great so I steamed some earlier using

this bamboo cone steamer now if you don't 
know anything about what this is and how

you make sticky rice with it I have another 
video that shows you I'm just going to toss

this rice a little bit so it comes out properly 
and thud so it's kind of its kind of cute ooh

I'm a five-person so I'm gonna go with thighs 
skin is nice and charred mmm a little dipping

sauce on it I have no words to describe how 
good this is I mean this tastes like Thailand

to me all the flavors salty sour spicy the fresh 
herbs the chewiness of the sticky rice oh my god

it's summertime barbecue season is coming and if 
it's not barbecue season where you live make it

any way you can even bake this in the oven it'll 
still be good so I hope hope you give this a try

it is so good trust me and the recipe fo Waze is 
on top I am calm and when you make it send me a

photo Facebook Twitter or Instagram and I will 
see you next time for your next delicious tiny
chicken in the Sun
